thread.title: BitTitan expands global operations & MigrationWiz tools
thread.title_full: BitTitan expands global operations & MigrationWiz tools

author: Catherine Knowles
title: BitTitan expands global operations & MigrationWiz tools
text:
BitTitan is undertaking substantial developments in its global operations, including the expansion of its sales team and enhancements to its MigrationWiz capabilities, as well as increasing technology investments to support cloud migrations.
General Manager Aaron Wadsworth emphasised the importance of these measures in the context of ongoing digital transformations. He stated, "As organisations continue to embrace digital transformation, investing in both our people and technology is crucial to delivering the best migration experience possible. With the expansion of our global teams and our ongoing product advancements, we're ensuring that our customers and partners can execute their cloud migrations efficiently and with confidence."
BitTitan's international growth strategy includes the expansion of teams in the Americas, EMEA, and APAC regions. This enhancement in personnel aims to fortify sales and customer support, ensuring that clients around the globe receive premium service and access to the company's migration tools.
Within this initiative, Eric Franklin assumes the role of Director of Sales for the Americas, bringing his background in customer engagement to advance sales in North and South America. Stuart Hughes, now Sales Manager for EMEA, will oversee sales operations and partnerships across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa, leveraging his account management expertise. In the APAC region, Shane Madz takes on the role of Sales Manager, aiming to grow BitTitan's market presence.
The company also announced significant advancements to its MigrationWiz product, designed to enhance speed, security, and overall performance. Notably, support for Teams Private Chat History migrations, along with improved security measures, control options, and streamlined processes, are included. The ongoing transition from legacy technologies to Microsoft Graph APIs represents a critical shift aimed at improving system efficiency and performance.
These upgrades are intended to make MigrationWiz faster and more reliable, a move that BitTitan believes will elevate the user experience and utility of its migration solutions.
Aaron Wadsworth outlined the company's future focus, saying, "With our strengthened global presence and significant product advancements, BitTitan is poised for continued success in 2025 and beyond. Our focus on innovation and customer success ensures that we not only meet but exceed the evolving needs of the industry, helping companies unlock new opportunities and achieve their digital transformation goals with certainty. We remain committed to delivering best-in-class migration solutions that empower organisations to achieve smooth, secure, and efficient cloud migrations - without risk or disruption."
BitTitan is focused on empowering IT service professionals to successfully deploy and manage cloud technologies through automation. MigrationWiz is the SaaS solution for mailbox, document, public folder, Microsoft Teams, and Active Directory migrations between a wide range of Sources and Destinations. Since 2009, BitTitan has migrated over 28 million users to the cloud for 46,000 customers in 188 countries, supporting leading cloud ecosystems including Microsoft and Google.
